name: my sentiment
description:
“why did he do it?” “he” became “e” and the rest of the alphabet helped tell the story through a range of feelings I confronted as I attempted to put myself in e’s shoes. e has gone on to represent empathy. the more we talk about our loss and share our stories, the more we understand each others’ struggles. those struggles will always be a part of our story and who we are. 

It’s been 29 years since my dad died by suicide. Putting myself in e’s shoes led to empathy. Which allowed forgiveness. Then acceptance. “e” will always be a part of me.  

All profits will support the important work of AFSP. My hope is that we can continue to bring suicide out of the darkness and remove the stigma and shame that can make healing so difficult. 

You can find the full story @instagram/sentiment_project. Animation by Wiz.
